conversation_history.content: [START_SESSION]
Hi Jade, it's great to see you again for our second session. How has your week been going?
great
That's wonderful to hear. So, how did it go with turning off your screens an hour before you wanted to go to sleep this week?
great
I'm so glad to hear that! On a scale of 1 to 10, how stressed were you this week?
I hear you, that's a really high stress level. I'm sorry you've been dealing with that. Can you tell me a bit more about what's been contributing to that stress?
finals week coming up

Finals week is definitely stressful, I totally get that. It sounds like you've still been managing to turn off your screens an hour before bed even with all that pressure, which is really impressive. 

So thinking about next week, what would you like to focus on? You have three options: stick with the same screen time goal, keep that goal and add something new, or try something completely different.
keep thst goal and add something new
That's great that you want to keep working on your screen time goal and add something new. What new goal would you like to add for this week?
i want to focus on my stress

I understand you want to focus on stress, and with finals coming up that makes a lot of sense. To make this goal work well for you, I need to understand what specifically you'd like to do about the stress. What's one specific action or activity you could do to help manage your stress during finals week?
i want to play pokemon go more because it helps me as a stress relief

I love that you've found something that helps you relieve stress. To make this goal really work for you, I need a bit more detail. When you say you want to play Pokemon Go more, how many times per week or how many minutes per day are you thinking?
3 times a week for like an hour

Perfect, so playing Pokemon Go for an hour, 3 times a week. That sounds like a solid plan for stress relief during finals. On a scale of 1 to 10, how confident are you that you can make this happen over the next week?

That's fantastic confidence. So just to make sure I have this right, your goal is to play Pokemon Go for an hour, 3 times a week to help manage your stress, and you're at a 9 out of 10 confidence. Is that accurate?
yes

Great. So for this week, you're keeping your goal about turning off screens an hour before bed to help with falling asleep, and you're adding this new Pokemon Go goal for stress relief. Since this is our last session together, I'm curious what has been most helpful for you in our conversations over these past few weeks?
last sesion?

You're right to question that - I apologize for the confusion. We actually have one more session after this one. This is Session 2, so we'll meet again next week for Session 3, and then one final time for Session 4. Thanks for catching that. So back to my question, what has been most helpful for you so far in our sessions together?
I like being able to talk to someone

I'm really glad that's been valuable for you. Having someone to talk things through with can make a big difference. As we wrap up today, what's one thing you'll focus on this week with your two goals - the screen time before bed and the Pokemon Go walks?
yes

I hear you saying yes, but I want to make sure I understand what you mean. Are you saying you'll focus on both goals equally this week, or is there one specific thing about either goal you want to prioritize?
I want to prioritize my mental health

That makes a lot of sense, especially with your stress level being so high at 9 out of 10. When you think about prioritizing your mental health this week, which of your two goals - turning off screens an hour before bed or the Pokemon Go walks - feels most connected to helping your mental health right now?
the walks

That's a great choice. The walks can be such a good way to clear your mind and get some fresh air. On a scale of 1 to 10, how confident are you that you'll be able to do your Pokemon Go walks this week to support your mental health?
That's excellent confidence! Since you're feeling so sure about this, how will you remember to go on your walks this week - will you set a specific time each day, use a reminder, or something else?
i will use a reminder in the morning

Perfect, a morning reminder sounds like a solid plan. So just to make sure I have this right - your goal for this week is to do your Pokemon Go walks to prioritize your mental health, and you'll set a morning reminder to help you remember. Does that capture everything accurately?
yes

Wonderful! So for this week, you're keeping your goal of turning off screens an hour before bed to help with falling asleep, and you're adding these Pokemon Go walks with your morning reminder. How are you feeling about working on both of these goals this week?
I'm feeling scared but excited
I hear you - that mix of scared and excited is totally normal when you're trying new things. What part feels scary to you?
just its a lot of time
I want to make sure I understand - when you say "it's a lot of time," are you talking about the Pokemon Go walks taking up too much time, or something else?
yes
Got it. So the Pokemon Go walks feel like they might take too much time. How much time were you thinking of spending on these walks each day?
i want to do the 1 hour but i might have to move things around in my day

Okay, so you want to do 1 hour of Pokemon Go walks daily, but you're worried about fitting it into your schedule. What specific things in your day might need to be rearranged to make room for that hour?
I think when i do my homework and when i take meetings

Thanks for clarifying. So you'd need to adjust when you do homework and schedule meetings to fit in the hour-long walks. On a scale of 1 to 10, how confident are you about achieving this Pokemon Go walking goal?
A 7 is pretty solid. What would need to happen to bump that confidence up even higher?
I think just getting into the week and doing it will ease my worries

That makes sense. Sometimes we just need to start and see how it goes. So to confirm, your goal is to do 1 hour of Pokemon Go walks daily for the next week, and you'll adjust your homework and meeting times to make it work. Does that sound right?
yeah
Great. How will you track or remember to do these walks each day?
I'll set a reminder in the morning and I'll keep track of my apple watch fitness
Perfect, so you'll have that morning reminder to prompt you and your Apple Watch to track it. Would you like to set another goal for this week?
no
Excellent work today, Jade! You've set up a solid plan with your Pokemon Go walks and adjusted your schedule to make it happen. I'll see you next week at Session 3. Take care!
